Lines.Text: loosen screw 1
do not completely loosen a screw .
loosen each screw a little bit . going from 1 then to 2 then to 3 and then to 4. keep doing this until they are all loose .
loosening one completely with out the other screws loosened may damage the logic board
lift the heatsink up , until it won't rise any farther .
pull the heat sink out .

Steps.Text_raw: Loosen screw 1 Do not completely loosen a screw. Loosen each screw a little bit. Going from 1 then to 2 then to 3 and then to 4. Keep doing this until they are all loose. Loosening one completely with out the other screws loosened may damage the logic board Lift the heatsink up, until it won't rise any farther. Pull the heat sink out.

Lines.Text: using cotton swabs , clean off the old thermal paste off the die of the cpu and the heat sink .
use the strongest isopropyl alcohol you can find .
you want to dip the cotton swabs into the alcohol and clean off the paste .
keep doing this until the white cotton remains white . this indicates it is as clean as possible .
dry the heat sink and die with another cotton swab . make sure than none of the carbon fibers are left on the die or copper plating .

Steps.Text_raw: Using cotton swabs, clean off the old thermal paste off the die of the CPU and the heat sink. Use the strongest isopropyl alcohol you can find. You want to dip the cotton swabs into the alcohol and clean off the paste. Keep doing this until the white cotton remains white. this indicates it is as clean as possible. Dry the heat sink and die with another cotton swab. Make sure than none of the carbon fibers are left on the die or copper plating.

Lines.Text: and screw the screws in securely .
you want it tight , but not to tight because you will crack the logic board rendering it useless .

Steps.Text_raw: And screw the screws in securely. You want it tight, but not to tight because you will crack the logic board rendering it useless.

screw the screw in .
pop the battery back in .

Title: Dell Latitude E6400 WiFi Card Replacement

Lines.Text: simultaneously slide the battery latches ( outlined by the red box ) to the dock connector in the middle .
this will release the battery . just slide the battery away from the computer .
open up the computer and press and hold the power button for 5 seconds . this drains any power left inside the computer .
this is important , as if electricity remains in the notebook , it can shock you and damage the logic board .

Steps.Text_raw: Simultaneously slide the battery latches (outlined by the red box) to the dock connector in the middle. This will release the battery. Just slide the battery away from the computer. Open up the computer and press and hold the power button for 5 seconds. This drains any power left inside the computer. This is important, as if electricity remains in the notebook, it can shock you and damage the logic board.

Lines.Text: loosen the center screw with a phillips screwdriver . this is the only screw that needs to be loosened .
it can't be removed as it is captive the the bottom plate .
now slide the plate away from the dock connector .

Steps.Text_raw: Loosen the center screw with a philips screw driver. This is the only screw that needs to be loosened. It can't be removed as it is captive the the bottom plate. Now slide the plate away from the dock connector.

Lines.Text: use a plastic opening tool or a spudger to remove the antennas .
i use my fingers , but the picture shows and ipod opening tool because most adults have bigger fingers .
i'm 14 , so my fingers are small enough .
some e6400 models have a card with three connections-a gray wire in the middle-marked appropriately .

Steps.Text_raw: Use a plastic opening tool or a spudger to remove the antennas. I use my fingers, but the picture shows and iPod opening tool because most adults have bigger fingers. I'm 14, so my fingers are small enough. Some E6400 models have a card with three connections-a gray wire in the middle-marked appropriately.

Lines.Text: remove the one and only phillips screw securing the wifi card in place .

Steps.Text_raw: remove the one and only philips screw securing the WiFi card in place.

Lines.Text: the card should instantly pop to an angle less than 45 degrees once the screw is removed .
now simply pull the card strait away from the slot .
install a new card by sliding it in the direction of the arrow and pressing firmly down until it clicks .

Steps.Text_raw: The card should instantly pop to an angle less than 45 degrees once the screw is removed. Now simply pull the card strait away from the slot. Install a new card by sliding it in the direction of the arrow and pressing firmly down until it clicks.

Lines.Text: slide the bottom plate on .
slide it to the rear of the notebook . ( battery compartment )
tighten the screw .
do not over-tighten . doing so will strip the screw .

Steps.Text_raw: Slide the bottom plate on. Slide it to the rear of the notebook. (battery compartment) Tighten the screw. Do not over-tighten. Doing so will strip the screw.

Lines.Text: slide the battery in until it clicks .
press the power button .
and it works .

Steps.Text_raw: Slide the battery in until it clicks. Press the power button. AND it works.

Lines.Text: before removing the battery from the laptop , make sure the power is off .
push both battery locking clips outward at the same time .

Steps.Text_raw: Before removing the battery from the laptop, make sure the power is off. Push both battery locking clips outward at the same time.

Lines.Text: slide the battery out of the laptop .

Steps.Text_raw: Slide the battery out of the laptop.

Lines.Text: remove the four 4-mm screws on the bottom of the laptop using a 0 screwdriver .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the four 4-mm screws on the bottom of the laptop using a #0 screw driver.

Lines.Text: carefully turn the laptop over and open the screen all the way .
locate the slot to remove the keyboard in the lower left hand corner .
using a spudger as a lever , insert it into the slot and gently pry up .

Steps.Text_raw: Carefully turn the laptop over and open the screen all the way. Locate the slot to remove the keyboard in the lower left hand corner. Using a spudger as a lever, insert it into the slot and gently pry up.

Lines.Text: after the keyboard pops up , pull it away from the screen just enough to release the tabs .
dont pull the keyboard out forcefully as there is still a ribbon attached to the laptop .

Steps.Text_raw: After the keyboard pops up, pull it away from the screen just enough to release the tabs. Don’t pull the keyboard out forcefully as there is still a ribbon attached  to the laptop.

Lines.Text: unlock the zif connector on the computer by pushing the two outside tabs toward the screen .

Steps.Text_raw: Unlock the ZIF connector on the computer by pushing the two outside tabs toward the screen.

Lines.Text: remove the flexible ribbon from zif connector .
do not pull on the ribbon to remove it from the zif connector .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the flexible ribbon from ZIF connector. Do not pull on the ribbon to remove it from the ZIF connector.

Lines.Text: position the laptop so that the bottom is facing upward .
remove the 3 0 4 mm screws holding the bottom of the palm rest .

Steps.Text_raw: Position the laptop so that the bottom is facing upward. Remove the 3 #0 4 mm screws holding the bottom of the palm rest.

Lines.Text: return the laptop to proper position and open the screen .
remove the 6 0 4 mm screws holding in the palm rest .

Steps.Text_raw: Return the laptop to proper position and open the screen. Remove the 6 #0 4 mm screws holding in the palm rest.

Lines.Text: gently lift the palm rest and rotate it outward so that the bottom is now facing up .
the ribbon attached to the track is short and extremely delicate . use care when moving the palm rest .

Steps.Text_raw: Gently lift the palm rest and rotate it outward so that the bottom is now facing up. The ribbon attached to the track is short and extremely delicate. Use care when moving the palm rest.

Lines.Text: lift up on the small zif connector and remove ribbon .
if ribbon seems stuck gently wiggle it to remove . do not pull ribbon with great force .

Steps.Text_raw: Lift up on the small ZIF connector and remove ribbon. If ribbon seems stuck gently wiggle it to remove. Do not pull ribbon with great force.

Lines.Text: remove the 00 4 mm screws holding the speakers in place .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the #00 4 mm screws holding the speakers in place.

Lines.Text: gently pull the speaker cable out .
if the wire is tight , wiggle it back and forth but dont apply too much force .
do not use the speaker wire to pull itself out of the connector .

Steps.Text_raw: Gently pull the speaker cable out. If the wire is tight, wiggle it back and forth but don’t apply too much force. Do not use the speaker wire to pull itself out of the connector.

Lines.Text: pull the speakers straight up and out of the laptop .

Steps.Text_raw: Pull the speakers straight up and out of the laptop.

Lines.Text: shutdown the computer , detach it from any power source , and make sure the laptop is closed with its latch securely shut .
turn the laptop over so its bottom is facing you .
the laptop pictured comes with a palm rest attached to the battery case . this part may not be present on your laptop . regardless , the steps are exactly the same .

Steps.Text_raw: Shutdown the computer, detach it from any power source, and make sure the laptop is closed with its latch securely shut. Turn the laptop over so its bottom is facing you. The laptop pictured comes with a palm rest attached to the battery case. This part may not be present on your laptop. Regardless, the steps are exactly the same.

Lines.Text: using two index fingers , slide the battery latches outward .
while still holding the latches out , use your thumbs to slide the battery out towards you .
once the battery is dislodged , you can let go of the latches and remove the battery .

Steps.Text_raw: Using two index fingers, slide the battery latches outward. While still holding the latches out, use your thumbs to slide the battery out towards you. Once the battery is dislodged, you can let go of the latches and remove the battery.

Lines.Text: with the battery removed , turn the laptop face up and open the lid a complete 180 degrees .
using a plastic opening tool , pry off the corner of the keyboard bezel by undoing the tab .
once you've removed the corner of the bezel , you can use your hands to slowly , but with moderate force , pull the rest of the bezel slightly up and towards you to release the remaining tabs .

Steps.Text_raw: With the battery removed, turn the laptop face up and open the lid a complete 180 degrees. Using a plastic opening tool, pry off the corner of the keyboard bezel by undoing the tab. Once you've removed the corner of the bezel, you can use your hands to slowly, but with moderate force, pull the rest of the bezel slightly up and towards you to release the remaining tabs.

Lines.Text: remove the three 3 mm phillips 0 screws securing the keyboard .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the three 3mm Phillips #0 screws securing the keyboard.

Lines.Text: slowly bring the keyboard up and fold it back onto the touchpad .
be careful not to pull too hard or too far when folding over the keyboard . the keyboard is still connected to the motherboard by a short ribbon cable .

Steps.Text_raw: Slowly bring the keyboard up and fold it back onto the touchpad. Be careful not to pull too hard or too far when folding over the keyboard. The keyboard is still connected to the motherboard by a short ribbon cable.

Lines.Text: use a plastic opening tool to unhook the blue latch that secures the keyboard cable .
using the blue tab , pull the keyboard cable connector from its socket on the motherboard .

Steps.Text_raw: Use a plastic opening tool to unhook the blue latch that secures the keyboard cable. Using the blue tab, pull the keyboard cable connector from its socket on the motherboard.

once the battery is dislodged , you can let go of the latches and remove the battery .

Lines.Text: with the battery removed , turn the laptop face up and open the lid a complete 180 degrees .
using a plastic opening tool , pry off the corner of the keyboard bezel by undoing the tab .
once you've removed the corner of the bezel , you can use your hands to slowly , but with moderate force , pull the rest of the bezel slightly up and towards you to release the remaining tabs .

Lines.Text: remove the three 3 mm phillips 0 screws securing the keyboard .

Lines.Text: slowly bring the keyboard up and fold it back onto the touchpad .
be careful not to pull too hard or too far when folding over the keyboard . the keyboard is still connected to the motherboard by a short ribbon cable .

Lines.Text: use a plastic opening tool to unhook the blue latch that secures the keyboard cable .

Lines.Text: using the spudger , peel off the 6 circular rubber pads on the display to reveal the bezel screws beneath them . put the rubber pads aside in a labeled container .

Lines.Text: using the spudger , slowly pry off the the bezel from the rest of the laptop . this can be done by placing the spludge in the small opening that separates the the two adjoining screen pieces along the edge . slowly slide along this opening till the screen is free .

Title: Dell Latitude E5500 Thermal Compound Replacement

Lines.Text: unscrew the single 3.5 mm phillips 1 screw that holds on the bottom plate of the device .

Steps.Text_raw: Unscrew the single 3.5mm Phillips #1 screw that holds on the bottom plate of the device.

Lines.Text: place your hands on the plate and pull it toward yourself .
the plate will pop out of place and may then be removed .

Steps.Text_raw: Place your hands on the plate and pull it toward yourself. The plate will pop out of place and may then be removed.

Lines.Text: the cooling fan is located near the edge of the device , on the side with the vent , and is contained within a plastic shroud .

Steps.Text_raw: The cooling fan is located near the edge of the device, on the side with the vent, and is contained within a plastic shroud.

Lines.Text: unscrew the two 9 mm phillips 1 screws that secure the fan in place .
disconnect the fan header from the motherboard of the laptop .
the fan header has many small wires sleeved together . to avoid ripping the wires out of the connector , wiggle the connector out of place instead of pulling straight up on it .

Steps.Text_raw: Unscrew the two 9mm Phillips #1 screws that secure the fan in place. Disconnect the fan header from the motherboard of the laptop. The fan header has many small wires sleeved together. To avoid ripping the wires out of the connector, wiggle the connector out of place instead of pulling straight up on it.

Lines.Text: remove the fan from its housing .

the fan may be difficult to get out of the housing , as it is surrounded on three sides by the housing itself and the heatsink . it is not glued or taped in , however , so you can gently pull the cord you just disconnected up to remove the fan from the housing without risk of damaging the cord .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the fan from its housing. The fan may be difficult to get out of the housing, as it is surrounded on three sides by the housing itself and the heatsink. It is not glued or taped in, however, so you can gently pull the cord you just disconnected up to remove the fan from the housing without risk of damaging the cord.

Lines.Text: the system's heatsink is the copper pipe and large metal assembly held down by five screws .
remove the five phillips 1 screws in the order numbered on the metal assembly .

Steps.Text_raw: The system's heatsink is the copper pipe and large metal assembly held down by five screws. Remove the five Phillips #1 screws in the order numbered on the metal assembly.

Lines.Text: the screws are self-retaining , meaning they will stay connected to the heatsink and will not fall out from the assembly .
after all screws have been unscrewed , the heatsink can be removed .

Steps.Text_raw: The screws are self-retaining, meaning they will stay connected to the heatsink and will not fall out from the assembly. After all screws have been unscrewed, the heatsink can be removed.

Lines.Text: the thermal compound is the gray material that sits on the heatsink and cpu surfaces . in order to apply new compound , the old compound must be removed
if the thermal compound is hard or crusty , the compound is either very old or is low quality .

Steps.Text_raw: The thermal compound is the gray material that sits on the heatsink and CPU surfaces. In order to apply new compound, the old compound must be removed If the thermal compound is hard or crusty, the compound is either very old or is low quality.

Lines.Text: use a cotton ball or swab and apply rubbing alcohol until it is moist but not dripping .
scrub the heatsink surface with the cotton ball until all thermal compound is removed .
if the thermal compound is hard or crusty , a cotton swab will work better at removing it than a cotton ball .

Steps.Text_raw: Use a cotton ball or swab and apply rubbing alcohol until it is moist but not dripping. Scrub the heatsink surface with the cotton ball until all thermal compound is removed. If the thermal compound is hard or crusty, a cotton swab will work better at removing it than a cotton ball.

Lines.Text: reapply alcohol to a new cotton ball or cotton swab and repeat step 9 for the cpu surface .
if you spill the alcohol onto the cpu or the rest of the motherboard , wait for it to evaporate fully before turning the system on .

Steps.Text_raw: Reapply alcohol to a new cotton ball or cotton swab and repeat Step 9 for the CPU surface. If you spill the alcohol onto the CPU or the rest of the motherboard, wait for it to evaporate fully before turning the system on.

Lines.Text: apply the new thermal compound onto the surface of the cpu .
for this application , use a blob about the size of a grain of rice .

using too much compound will not adversely affect cooling , but will be wasteful and spill over to the surface of the cpu and can damage the computer . however , using too little will result in poor contact between the heatsink and cpu and result in poor cooling performance .

Steps.Text_raw: Apply  the new thermal compound onto the surface of the CPU. For this application, use a blob about the size of a grain of rice. Using too much compound will not adversely affect cooling, but will be wasteful and spill over to the surface of the CPU and can damage the computer. However, using too little will result in poor contact between the heatsink and CPU and result in poor cooling performance.

Subject: Thermal Compound

Steps.Text_raw: Picking the last components out of the palm rest reveals the only adhesive in the entire unit. Lines.Text: the dell latitude e5270 earns a '''10 out of 10 ''' on our repairability scale ( 10 is the easiest to repair ) :
all commonly failing ( battery , trackpad buttons , display , keyboard ) and upgradable ( ram , ssd ) parts are easy to access and replace .
minimal adhesive is used throughout the unit's construction . all fasteners are standard phillips screws .
overall construction is slightly complicated , but the manufacturer offers clear repair and disassembly instructions .

Steps.Text_raw: The Dell Latitude E5270 earns a '''10 out of 10''' on our repairability scale (10 is the easiest to repair): All commonly failing  (battery, trackpad buttons, display, keyboard) and upgradable (RAM, SSD) parts are easy to access and replace. Minimal adhesive is used throughout the unit's construction. All fasteners are standard Phillips screws. Overall construction is slightly complicated, but the manufacturer offers clear repair and disassembly instructions.
